intro: Praravinia multinervia, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It possesses small, elliptical leaves that are typically covered with a fine layer of white pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains one or two seeds. Praravinia multinervia is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
